DOCNAME: CASE OF VERENIGING WEEKBLAD BLUF! v. THE NETHERLANDS
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 10;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant is an association based in GPE and at the material time it published a DATE called PERSON ! for a left - wing readership . Since then the periodical has ceased publication .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE the editorial staff of PERSON ! came into possession of a DATE report by the internal security service ( Binnenlandse Veiligheidsdienst - " the BVD " ) . Dated DATE and marked " Confidential " , it was designed mainly to inform ORG staff and other officials who carried out work for the ORG about the organisation ’s activities . It showed that at that time the ORG was interested in , among other groups , ORG of the GPE and the anti - nuclear movement . It also mentioned ORG plan to open an office in GPE and gave information about the NORP , NORP and NORP security services’ activities in the GPE .
The editor of PERSON ! proposed to publish the report with a commentary as a supplement to issue no . CARDINAL of the journal on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , before the journal was published or sent out to subscribers , the director of the ORG informed the public prosecutor ( PERSON ) of the plan to publish the report and pointed out that its dissemination was likely to infringe Article PERSON paras . CARDINAL and CARDINAL and Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE - see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . In his letter he stated :

" Although , in my opinion , the various contributions taken separately do not ( or do not any longer ) contain any ORG secrets , they do - taken together and read in conjunction - amount to information whose confidentiality is necessary in the interests of the ORG or its allies . This is because the juxtaposition of the facts gives an overview , in the various sectors of interest , of the information available to the security service and of the ORG ’s activities and method of operation . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE a preliminary judicial investigation ( gerechtelijk vooronderzoek ) in respect of a person or persons unknown was commenced on an application by the public prosecutor . The investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) of ORG ( arrondissementsrechtbank ) ordered the applicant association ’s LOC to be searched and had the entire print run of issue no . CARDINAL of GPE ! , including the supplement , seized . The police apparently did not take away the offset plates remaining on the printing presses . CARDINAL people were arrested but released DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG During TIME CARDINAL DATE , unknown to the authorities , the staff of the applicant association managed to reprint the issue that had been seized . CARDINAL copies were sold in the streets of GPE DATE , which was the ORG ’s birthday and a national holiday . The authorities decided not to put a stop to this so as not to cause any public disorder .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the investigating judge closed the investigation on the ground that he had no basis on which to continue it . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the public prosecutor informed the applicant association that proceedings against the CARDINAL people arrested during the seizure were being dropped , as the evidence against CARDINAL of them was insufficient and the third had played a minimal role .

CARDINAL . ORG In the meantime , on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant association had complained of the seizure to ORG of ORG under Article PERSON of LAW ( PERSON - see paragraph QUANTITY below ) , seeking the return of the confiscated copies , their supplements and the wrappers so that they could be sent out to subscribers in time .

This application was dismissed on DATE in so far as it related to the copies of the journal and supplement . The court considered that , in view of their content , it was not " highly unlikely " that in the criminal proceedings an order would be made for the periodical ’s withdrawal from circulation ( onttrekking aan het verkeer ) . The court did , however , order the return of an insert entitled " A Contribution to the Jewish History Museum " and the wrappers .

CARDINAL . ORG In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( PERSON ( GPE ) DATE , CARDINAL ) ORG dismissed appeals on points of law that the applicant association and the public prosecutor lodged against that decision . In respect of the applicant association ’s ground of appeal based on a violation of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the court held that the right secured in that provision was limited by the phrase " subject to each person ’s liability under the law " and that the seizure of the printed matter to be distributed was among the measures capable of safeguarding the interests which ORG and FAC of LAW were intended to protect .

CARDINAL . ORG In the interval , on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant association had lodged a second complaint with ORG of ORG . Relying on DATE ( article CARDINAL ) of the Convention , it challenged the lawfulness ( rechtmatigheid ) of the seizure . In the alternative , it sought the return of the confiscated items on the ground that as the judicial investigation had been terminated , the measure had ceased to be justified .

On DATE the court dismissed the complaint . It ruled that it was identical with the CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE and that no new factor justified returning the property . Relying on the statement from the public prosecutor ’s office to the effect that it would make an application to have the journal withdrawn from circulation as soon as ORG had given judgment on the appeal on points of law against the decision of DATE , the court held that it was still not to be excluded that such a measure might be taken . Consequently , it rejected the applicant association ’s submission based on the decision not to prosecute ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the public prosecutor applied to ORG for an order that issue no . CARDINAL of GPE ! should be withdrawn from circulation .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the court allowed the application on the basis of ORG and ORG of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . It held that as the seized items were designed to commit the offence set out in LAW and/or Article CARDINALa para . CARDINAL taken together with para . CARDINAL of LAW , the unsupervised possession of them was contrary to the law and the public interest . Moreover , the measure was justified under LAW ) of the Convention on the grounds of maintaining " national security " .
CARDINAL . ORG In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( GPE DATE , CARDINAL ) ORG dismissed an appeal on points of law by the applicant association .

It held that the court below had clearly established that an offence covered either by Article CARDINALa para . CARDINAL taken together with para . CARDINAL or by LAW had been committed and that it did not have to choose between the provisions indicated . Articles CARDINALb para . CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and ORG para . CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) were applicable even though neither the applicant association nor any other person had had to answer for their actions in the criminal proceedings . The reprinting and distribution of the issue in dispute after the seizure was no bar either , since the fact of making information public , covered by LAW , did not necessarily have the consequence that secrecy should not be preserved . Articles CARDINAL and ORG contained statutory provisions envisaged in LAW ) of the LAW ; since the seizure and withdrawal from circulation were designed to safeguard the interests protected by ORG and ORG , they fell within the permitted restrictions on the right to freedom of expression . In referring to national security , the court below had clearly shown that what was in issue in the instant case was information whose secrecy was necessary in the interests of the ORG . Lastly , the seizure and withdrawal from circulation could not be equated with imposing a condition of " prior authorisation " , even though the public could not acquaint itself with the opinions and ideas contained in the printed matter .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the LAW provides :
" No one shall need prior authorisation in order to express his opinions or ideas through the press , subject to each person ’s liability under the law . "
CARDINAL . ORG At the material time the relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
" An order for the withdrawal of seized items from circulation may be made
( CARDINAL ) in a judgment in which a person is convicted of a criminal offence and a sentence is imposed ;
( CARDINAL ) in a separate judicial order made on an application by the public prosecutor . "
" Any of the following items are liable to be withdrawn from circulation :

( CARDINAL ) those made or intended for the commission of the offence ; in so far as they are of such a nature that the unsupervised possession of them is contrary to the law or the public interest . "

" CARDINAL . Anyone who deliberately communicates or puts at the disposal of a person or organisation not authorised to have knowledge of it any information whose secrecy is necessary in the interests of the ORG or its allies , or any item from which it is possible to extract such information , shall , if he knows or should reasonably suspect that the information is of this kind , be liable to imprisonment for a period not exceeding DATE or a fine of the fifth category .

CARDINAL . A person shall be liable to the same penalty if he deliberately communicates , or makes available to a person or organisation not authorised to have knowledge of it , any information from a prohibited locality and relating to the security of the ORG or of its allies , or any item from which it is possible to extract such information , if he knows or should reasonably suspect that the information is of this kind . "

" CARDINAL . Any person who deliberately divulges information of the kind referred to in DATE ... shall , if he knows or should reasonably suspect that the information is of this kind , be liable to imprisonment for a period not exceeding DATE or a fine of the fifth category .
CARDINAL . ...

CARDINAL . The acts carried out in preparation of an offence as defined in the foregoing paragraphs shall be punishable with imprisonment for a period not exceeding DATE or a fine of the fifth category . "
" CARDINAL . The following shall be liable to imprisonment for a period not exceeding DATE or a fine of the fifth category :
( CARDINAL ) anyone who , without having been so authorised , takes or keeps in his possession any information referred to in LAW ;
CARDINAL . ORG The main provisions of LAW mentioned in this case are the following :
" Any items which may serve to establish the truth or whose confiscation or withdrawal from circulation can be ordered shall be liable to be seized . "
" During the preliminary judicial investigation the investigating judge shall be empowered to seize any items liable to confiscation . "
" The parties concerned shall be able by way of application to make a complaint in respect of seizures , the use made of confiscated items or delay in ordering the return [ of such items ] ... "
